dialogues.text: Where is she?

Ilenka gestures to an area beyond the party goers. Stepha t pushes her way through the crowd. She stumbles and fall the Corpse of Mrs. Ganush! As per the custom of the Gypsy wake, there is no coffin, her dead body that rests atop a coffee table. Stephanie has landed atop the corpse! The leg of the coff table breaks under the weight of the two women. Stephanie tumbles to the ground, the corpse landing atop her. The c of mourners GASP. The dead woman's opened mouth bobs up and down upon Stephanie's chin, as through it were once again suckling Stephanie shoves the corpse off of her and backs away in revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: ILENKA
dialogues.text: Still going to make everything all right? The mourners replace the corpse atop the coffee table. Ilenka addresses the crowd in Hungarian. She tells them t it was this white trash farm girl that threw her grandmot t from her home and that she now bears the curse of Lamia A mother shields her daughter's eyes from the sight of Stephanie, the cursed one, then hurriedly kisses her .crucifix. A man spits at her feet then walks off.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No, please-- I needed her to take this thing off me.

dialogues.speaker: ILENKA
dialogues.text: It will never come off.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You know about it? Then, please help me. I'm begging you.

dialogues.speaker: ILENKA
dialogues.text: She said you'd come begging. I only wish she could have lived to see it. The blood drains from Stephanie's face.

dialogues.speaker: ILENKA
dialogues.text: .maybe she can... Stephanie glances down to the corpse. It's head is now facing her. It's dead eyes, OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie puts her foot through RHAM Jas' TV set. Shatter the tube, commanding his. attention.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Fuck that! I paid you a hundred and seventy nine dollars for that book!

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: It was a limited printing! Please control yourself!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I did what you said- that blood offering... I killed that little kitty deader than Hogan's goat. Lotta good that did me.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: We are dealing with elusive and powerful forces. There are no guarantees. She wants to shout, but instead, closes her eyes and sits

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Just tell me what to do. Rham Jas considers. A dark look crosses his face. Stephan tries to read his expression.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE'S MASTERCARD
dialogues.text: It's run through the carbon paper. Rham Jas hand her a receipt. She signs it. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: We must somehow dissuade the spirit from taking your soul.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: 1 A seance. And it should be soon.  For tomorrow will be the third night...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Have you done this before?

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: No. But I know someone. I can arrange what is necessary, but you must understand that everyone involved in this would be taking a great risk with their lives.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What would you need from me? Rham Jas thinks for a moment, weighing the dangers. He pu out a pipe and packs it with tobacco. He tamps it down an lights up.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Twenty thousand dollars. Cash. By tomorrow. 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie is hastily piling all her valuables atop her be sporting equipment, TV, VCR/DVD COMBO, CD player, IPOD, E Ellen enters, rattled.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Ellen. I'm sorry. This a bad time right now. I got a little emergency and... say you got any cash I can borrow? She starts stuffing the valuables into a large duffle bag

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: No, I don't. But Steph I--

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: --what about your credit cards? What's your cash advance limit? (MORE)
STEPHANIE (cont'd) I'll pay you back. You know I'm good for it.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Steph, we need to talk about the cat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Where has that little rascal been? He's always running off, have you noticed that?

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Stephanie. I was in the back yard and I saw where the ground was dug up. I started digging and... You buried that little kitty in our backyard. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I didn't want to tell you. It fell out the window and died. It's sad,

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I found the bloody knife in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What are you, a cat detective?

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Steph? I'm going to tell you this as your friend. There is something seriously wrong with you. Stephanie looks up from,her frantic panting.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Uh... Duhi

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I'm moving out. I can't live like this. STEPHANIE. Fine. Ellen exits. Stephanie angrily calls after her:

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: An' don't let the barn door hit you on your ass on yer way out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie is speaking into a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I can't get the twenty thousand. You're gonna have to help me with what I've got.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS' VOICE
dialogues.text: What do you have? She covers the mouthpiece, speaking to someone off camera

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: How much?! CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal that we are'in a PAWN SHOP. M haggle loudly in Arabic over the price of a gold chain. T PAWN BROKER stands before-all of Stephanie's worldly belongings: A toaster oven, computer, racing bike, stereo microwave oven, necklaces, jewelry...

dialogues.speaker: PAWN BROKER
dialogues.text: Thirty-eight hundred for everything.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Including my jewlery?

dialogues.speaker: PAWN BROKER
dialogues.text: Including. Stephanie curses under her breath, checks the balance on checkbook, does the math, speaks into the phone;

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Six thousand.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Look, I'll give you six now and--

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: No. There will be others involved and I cannot-ask them to accept such a risk for less. Good night. He hangs up. The line goes dead. She tries to throw the p but it's attached with a short metal cord. She turns to t Pawn Broker.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I'll take it! Stephanie thinks about how she'll get the extra cash. She hesitantly dials a number on the pay phone. It rings and rings as she glances to a picture buried deep in her wall A. photo of... The younger, obese Stephanie and her stern looking Mother Both stand before a bleak snow covered, mid-western farm.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Mom? Hi, it's me. Did you get,the Christmas card? Yeah, I guess it has been a while. Listen, I'm in kind of a fix, here. I've been pretty sick and I need to borrow some money for an operation. I need fourteen thousand dollars right away. Now I know you still have that pension fund at the credit Union so-- yeah, but... okay. Okay, it's just that--- I understand. Okay, mom. Bye. The line goes dead. She slumps down against the pay phone

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: She pouts her lips in the mirror, carefully applying lipstick. Looking good.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: To reveal we are in the employee bathroom at the bank. Sh fixes her hair so it's just right. She. straightens out a wrinkle in her business suit, smiles her best upbeat smil and exits the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BANK OF CALIFORNIA- DAY
dialogues.text: Stephanie approaches Mr. Jacks.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Mr. Jacks, this is kind of awkward for me... I know it's not official yet, but I was wondering if I could get a copy of the employment contract for the new position you offered me?

dialogues.speaker: MR. JACKS
dialogues.text: The assistant manager's position?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Yes. See, one of my family members is having a little emergency which requires me to get them an immediate loan--

dialogues.speaker: MR. JACKS
dialogues.text: --Stephanie... There's a problem. The McPherson deal was cancelled last night.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What? 1

dialogues.speaker: MR. JACKS
dialogues.text: Yeah, right after I informed the main branch that we had this big loan pending,,I find out that they just made their deal over at First National. I got a call in to see, what exactly happened but right now this doesn't look too good for you or me. So this assistant manager promotion has been delayed. In fact, I think that with everything that's been happening, I'm gonna have to give that job to Stu. Stephanie is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Stu. I see. Mr. Jacks sees tears begin to well up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JACKS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Look. If you've got family problems. Maybe you should take the day off and sort them out. Stephanie node and exits the bank.

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL CLOCK
dialogues.text: As it TICKS away the seconds. CLOSE SHOT - THE Inadequate PILE OF CASH That site atop Stephanie's Kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: A DESPONDENT STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: stares down at the cash. Her mouth mechanically opens to accept a large serving spoon of Rocky Road ice cream whic she eats directly from the one gallon tub. The door bell rings. A moment later Ray walks in.. Stepha stands, surprised. RAY. I paid Rham Jas

dialogues.speaker: STEPHAINE
dialogues.text: But I thought you didn't believe...

dialogues.speaker: RAY'
dialogues.text: I don't. But you do. I know this is important for, you . she embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Pasadena home site alone atop a hill. Ray's car dr up, parks.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Are you coming in?

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: I wanted to but Rham Jas said non believers weren't welcome. I still don't like this.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I know how crazy this must seem. But it will all be over after this I swear to you. He nods. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I'll call you when it's done.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: We'll laugh about it on the train, tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: t Yeah.  Stephanie steps from the car. Ray drives off. She turns t face the old house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milos, a thirty year old, Hungarian Man, leads Stephanie a large room with-tall, teak bookshelves and Indian tapestries that adorn the walls. Rham Jas is seated in a wicker chair,' speaking with someone obscured by shadows.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Miss Brown. Allow me the pleasure of an introduction... A woman rises from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: .Shaun San Dena The eighty year old woman smiles a toothless smile to Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Shaun San Dena is an experienced 41 medium. Furthermore, she has a personal knowledge of the Lamia.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: I first encountered this spirit forty years ago in a small village outside of Bucharest.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: SHUAN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: I lost a young boy's soul to the beast.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: That's reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: I was an. inexperienced seer then. I've learned much since that woeful day. I have waited these long years for a chance at redeeming myself. A chance to destroy the foul thing. Tonight my chance will come. But to summon it, I will need your help.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever it takes. And the sooner the better.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: Our business must wait till darkness falls. Enough time for tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ceiling twenty feet high, with massive windows covered dark burgundy drapes. An ornate crystal chandelier hangs above a round table in the room's center. Stephanie, Rham Jas, Shaun San Dena and Milos, are finishing their tea.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: My late husband, Sandor, was also a medium. He chose this site to build the'house upon because he sensed certain energies that intersected here... (MORE)

SHAUN SAN DENA (cont'd) He knew I would sense his spirit in this place as I have sensed others. It was to be our way of  being together after he died. In earlier times it was a sacred place to the Tuanteteck indians. And their stories told that the place was a burial ground of the "old ones" that inhabited the earth before them. Here, there is a particular alignment of energies. A confluence, that allows doorways to be opened. Through which, we might pass.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS '
dialogues.text: And through which, others might pass into our world. Milos removes the tea.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: It is time for us to begin. Shaun San Dena turns out the electric lights, leaving onl the tables' candlelight for illumination. We hear the BLEATING of a goat. Stephanie startles. Milos reenters the room pulling a black goat along by a chain. goat catches sight of Stephanie. It BLEATS in fear and attempts to run. But Milos holds it fast and tethers it t post. He moves to the table and lifts a velvet cloth revealing a large cattle slaughtering blade.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: Lord Jesus bless this knife and allow it to do your holy work. She makes the sign of the cross. she pours a .vial of hol water over the blade. She turns to Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: Once the spirit has entered me, place my hand upon the animal. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: I will force the spirit of the Lamia into the goat. Milos, that's when you strike. Stephanie blanches but remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: We must all.be receptive. Shaun San Dena begins to intone a Romanian Gypsy chant. Stephanie leans close to speak quietly with Rham Jae.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: You must allow the darkness in. You must invite the dead to co-mingle with your spirit..

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Yes. Now repeat these words... I welcome the dead into my soul... Rham Jae waits for Stephanie's response. She's shifts in seat uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I welcome the dead into my soul...

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: You must believe it! Stephanie takes a deep breath and they begin the chant ag This time,, together.

dialogues.speaker: RAM JAAS STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I welcome the dead into my I welcome the dead into my soul... soul... Stephanie looks around the darkened room. Shadows from th candles dance upon the walls.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: I sense something here with us.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Yes. The parlor's crystal chandeleir tinkles. A tea cup and saucer tremble for a moment. Stephanie's ey search the room.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING UNSEEN
dialogues.text: emits a wheezing breath... We hear FOOTSTEPS as something walks on the ceiling above them.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN'S LOUD LAUGHTER
dialogues.text: echoes about the room.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: It is not the Lamia. It is the spirit of some unsettled soul from 1  years ago... The unsettled ones wait near the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE PITCHER OF WATER
dialogues.text: upon the table is drained. Then the water is spat out in stream at Milos' face. The MAN'S LAUGHTER again.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: Be gone, foolish spirit! There is a HOWLING OF WIND and the room is again quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: Show yourself Lamia. We invite you into our circle. Quiet. Stephanie looks about. Nothing seems to be happeni

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: He's coming...
A faint sound. SCRATCH. SCRATCH. The SCRATCHING OF FINGERNAILS on wood. A sound that Stephanie's heard before. It grows louder, more distorted

dialogues.speaker: SCRATCH SCRATCH
dialogues.text: Stephanie grips the table. And just when the SCRATCHING SOUND is deafening... All becomes silent. Stephanie holds her breath. A wind whips up in the room sending papers whirling about yet all the windows are closed. Shaun San Dena's eyes roll up into her head. She emits a and powerful MOAN. Her head slumps onto her shoulders. Th she straightens with a new vigor. Stephanie and Rham Jas watch as her lips move rapidly and a garbled sound comes of her throat. she speaks in a strange and incomprehensib tongue.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Who now inhabits the body of Shaun San Dena?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: (demonic voice) Lamia... Rham Jas nods discreetly to Milos who quietly uncovers th slaughtering blade. RHAM JAS. Lamia, what is it that you desire? Shaun San Dena's chair abruptly spins about to face Stephanie. The mouth jerks opened and closed as if contro by a bad puppeteer. Then, out of.sync, the demonic voice

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: (demonic voice) The soul of Stephanie Brownl We will feast upon it, as she festers in the gravel 4

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It was my manager, Jim Jacks.  He was the one ! He--

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Silence! Lamia, please, surely we can dissuade you from taking this insignificant woman? Surely she's not worthy of your greatness. The possessed Shaun San Dena laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: (demonic voice) No! I will enjoy watching her skin blister and pop in hell's flame. I come for her! Stephanie quickly grabs Shaun San Derna's hand and places on the goat's head. Shaun San Dena's eyes clear for a moment as she struggles regain control. Now there are two spirits battling within her. She attemp t to force the spirit of the Lamia from her body and into goat. The Goat BLEATS and bucks wildly as the spirit is transferred. Milos raises up the slaughtering blade.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: (demonic voice) No! You--

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: (demonic voice) --tricked me! The possessed goat emits a terrible cry! The bone chillin SHRIEK of Lamia! It's oval eye reflects the blade as it descends toward it. The possessed Goat jerks aside and th blade misses, slicing into the chair. As Milos raises the blade for another blow, the goat bite his hand. In that moment, the spirit of the Lamia is transferred to him. A Possessed Milos SCREAMS and spins toward Stephanie, gla at her with black goat eyes. He SHOUTS at her in a gibber of tongues! His body jerks up into the air. He dances a j atop the table, now laughing uncontrollably. t
Stephanie watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Lamial I command you to leave this-- A chair sails through the air and shatters across Rham Ja back, knocking him to the ground. Milos' body is hurled up against the chandelier, shatteri it. Glass rains down upon Stephanie. on the ceiling, Milos is spun.about like a pin wheel. Stephanie races for the door but a .huge bureau lurches in front of her, blocking her path. Rham Jas rouses a stunned Shaun San Dena.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: You must banish the spirit! Shaun San Dena places her hands on her ayes, then over he heart and chants an ancient Gypsy incantation up toward Milos. Milos SHRIEKS. A white vapor streams from his body as the Lamia is torn from him.

dialogues.speaker: MILOS
dialogues.text: (in his normal voice) Stop the chanting. I beg you! But Shaun San Dena only chants louder. Milos SCREAMS grow more intense as-his body spasms in pain. Stephanie grasps Shaun San Dena.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: For god's sake, stop the chanting, it's killing him! Rham Jas pushes her aside.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: You must not stop! A withered pair of hands reach down from above and clutch Stephanie's face! It is Mrs. Ganush that now floats above her! Her long yellowed fingernails scratching at Stephani skin. 4

dialogues.speaker: MILOS/MRS. GANUSH
dialogues.text: Make her stop, you dirty pork queen!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No! Get her off! Mrs. Ganush grabs at Stephanie's head. Stephanie pulls aw but it costs her a clump of hair that Mrs. Ganush rips fr her head. Mrs. Ganush opens her mouth... wide... wider still... she vomits out Stephanie's dead cat. It lands atop the table. Stephanie screams uncontrollably. Shaun San Dena, is trembling as her chanting comes to a climax. Mrs. Ganush changes back to the possessed Milo. The last the white vapor is torn from Milos body as the spirit of Lamia leaves him. Milos falls to the floor and all is qui An ashen faced Shaun San Dena halts her chant.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Is it gone? Stephanie notices that the cat has vanished. Was it ever there? Rham Jae kneels at Milos' side. He's starting to come aro Milos stands, shaken. The Lamia is gone. Shaun San Dena grabs at her chest, struggles for breath. Stephanie rushes over to steady her.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Let me help you...

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN SAN DENA
dialogues.text: My heart. Shaun San Dena collapses into Stephanie's arms. Rham Jas moves to assist her. They lower Shaun San Dana to the flo

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Milos, call an ambulance! 0
Milos rushes from the room to call for help... Rham Jas checks for a pulse.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: She's not breathing. Rham Jas attempts to administer CPR to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: My God. My God... He checks her pulse one last time. The CPR is finally hal Rham Jas closes her eyes, then touches her forehead, pray

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Gata, gata, para gata... bodhi suaha. Gone, gone, gone beyond. Gone beyond the beyond. Hail the goer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie and Rham Jas watch as PARAMEDICS load the cover body of Shaun San Dena into the ambulance. They close the doors and drive away.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It's sad:

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Strange how things work out. She waited years for another chance to overcome the lamia ..and finally she did.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: No. I'm afraid you misunderstand. Rham Jas looks at her with pity.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: The,Lamia can not'be banished by a medium. This was our lesson tonight. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: 0  But I saw her get rid of the thing...

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: No. You saw her drive the Lamia from the seance. That is all. It will be back.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: But then, what am I supposed to do? Rham Jas shrugs. He fishes in his pocket for his car keys

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Perhaps on this final evening, you should finish up the business of this world. For before the night is through, the Lamia will come for the owner of the accursed object.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: Slowly emerges from her coat pocket. She studies the thin brass button in her palm. 0

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Unless, of course... you were no longer the owner.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No longer the owner? I don't understand. Rham Jas reaches into his coat pocket and removes a blank envelope. He places the button within and seals it.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: The Lamia comes for the owner of the accursed object. Just make a gift of it... To demonstrate, he hands the envelope to Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: .and you've given away the curse.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me this before?!

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Because we are speaking of murder. Stephanie looks from the envelope containing the button t Rham Jas. She places the envelope carefully into the side 'pocket of her purse. Rham Jas tries to conceal the sadne and fear he feels for her.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: Whatever you decide, you have until sunrise.' She nods goodbye as Ray's car pulls up. Ray opens the doo for her and she gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Stephanie drive through the quiet Pasadena neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Is it over? Stephanie, stares at her envelope, thinks about telling h then...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Yes. It's all over. Ray squeezes her hand. Appreciating the two of them now m than ever. Stephanie SCREAMS as... MRS. GANUSH.appears in the headlights, standing on the ro before them! Ray hits the breaks. The car SCREECHES to a halt! Stephanie's purse with the envelope and.some of Ray's pap fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Stephanie nods, catching her breath.

dialogues.speaker: R
dialogues.text: That guy came out of nowhere. Stephanie looks to the figure in the road. Mrs. Ganush is gone. In her place is an old man who mutters angrily at t and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY'S BMW pulls up and Stephanie gets out.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Are you'still okay about the Santa Barbara trip?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Yes, everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Okay. Our train leaves tomorrow morning. Seven A.M. When do you want me to pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It's better if we meet at the D station. There's something I've got to do on the way. Stephanie suddenly' clutches at her purse. The envelope i gone!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Wait! Where's my envelope?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What envelope? She opens the car door and frantically rummages around th floor, through Ray's papers.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It's got to be here! Then, Stephanie comes upon something under the seat. She smiles and stands. A white envelope held tightly in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Got , it . 0

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's gonna be a new start for, us. Don't be late. They kiss and Ray drives off.

dialogues.speaker: A WALL CLOCK
dialogues.text: The time is 1:30 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: drinks coffee and stares at the white envelope that's tuc into the side pocket of her purse. She scans the patrons considers giving it to each of them, then one by one, rej the idea.

dialogues.speaker: A WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Comes by, removes a dirty dish and refills her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Banana Boat Sundae.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Another one? Stephanie nods absently. The waitress exits.

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL CLOCK
dialogues.text: The time is now 2:15 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: A WITHERED OLD MAN
dialogues.text: site alone at a table in a wheelchair. A portable oxygen cylinder, supplying him with air.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: takes a deep breath, stands and walks to his table.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I wonder if you could help me out? The Old Man looks up, sees her desperation.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN 0
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I just need you to hang on to this envelope for me. Just until tomorrow. She extends the envelope to him. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: What's this all about?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Just take the envelope and I'll explain. Please. The Old Man considers. He reaches for the envelope when a OLD WOMAN, his wife, hobbles toward the table. The Old Ma helps her sit and puts away her cane. They turn to Stepha who withdraws the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Never mind. Stephanie returns to her seat, ashamed at what she almost did. She returns the envelope to the purse pocket, racking her brains, trying to think of some way out of this. Her gaze lands upon a stack of newspapers on the next table. She grabs the paper and finds the OBITUARIES.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: MRS. GANUSH'S OBITUARY: A photo of the old woman. The location of the burial is listed: Oakwood Cemetary. Stephanie rips the listing from the paper and rushes from restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie, lit by a barren light bulb, paces the room. Rh Jas in his pajamas, studies an old leather bound text.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Well? Is it possible? 0
He closes the book and gives it some thought.

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS
dialogues.text: There are Gypsy blessings that are bestowed upon the dead... And the Gypsies give gifts to their departed to curry favor with the deceased soul. Yes. I do believe you could give the curse to someone who has passed on... for truly, the soul never dies.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: As she drives we hear the voice over from the preceding

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .but you must make a formal gift of the cursed object to the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Formal gift... ? Car headlights sweep over her grim face. She fingers the envelope, then glances to the seat next to her... a SHOVE

dialogues.speaker: RHAM JAS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Give it to the corpse personally. Put it in their hand... their' pocket...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll do better than that... CAMERA moves in tight.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: .I'll shove it down her goddamn throat. She zips up her raincoat. SOMETHING flits past the window Too.quick to.see. Then it reappears. It's Mrs. Ganush's hankie. It.flies against Stephanie's windshield and gets caught on the wiper blade. Stephanie GASPS. It flaps in t wind, blocking her view. Stephanie hits the wiper button. The hankie is yanked-back and forth across the windshield

She turns up the wiper speed. No sooner is it knocked loo than it's whisked into the driver's side window. It slaps over Stephanie's eyes, plastered there by the'wind! The c swerves. Her car crashes into a tree.

dialogues.speaker: CRASHED CAR
dialogues.text: Stephanie pulls herself from the crash. She glances up to flash of lightning. It illuminates: The wrought iron gates of the OAKWOOD CEMETERY. A hill of tombstones beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light drizzle falls as Stephanie'searches the graveyard the burial place of Mrs. Ganush. She carries the shovel defensively, ready to swat at anything that might leap ou her. She stops before a freshly dug grave. A temporary marker reads the name. "Sylvia Ganush". She's scared now, not sure if she can really go through w it. A church bell TOLLS five times. There's no time to th about it. Stephanie looks around to make sure no one is watching, then starts to dig.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: LATER - It's raining harder. The hole Stephanie digs is n several feet deep. CLUNK: The shovel has hit the buried coffin. The rain intensifies.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: LATER - Mud is pouring down the sides of the grave. In th bottom of the pit Stephanie has unearthed the simple pine casket. She jams the shovel blade between two boards and pries off the coffin's top and shoves it aside. A lightning flash illuminates the corpse. Mrs. Ganush's w eye is open and staring at Stephanie. Stephanie stows her fear and pulls the white envelope fro her coat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I'm giving it back to you. She grabs Mrs. Ganush's hand and tries to get her clenche fist to open, but rigor morris has locked it shut. Stepha pulls with all her might, causing...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GANUSH'S CORPSE
dialogues.text: to lurch up and out of the coffin. Her dead arms, thrown forward from the momentum, wrap around Stephanie. Stephan SCREAMS! The withered face leers! Stephanie pushes the co away from her and the lifeless body falls back into the m

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You'll take it, all right... She picks up the shovel and jams the blade into the old woman's mouth, wedging it between her teeth. She pries th jaw open. Mud and rivulets of water begin pouring down in the grave from all sides. The body of Mrs. Ganush is quic being re-buried.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I, Stephanie Brown, do hereby make a formal gift of this button to you, Sylvia Ganush. She jams the white envelope down the old woman's throat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Choke on it, bitch. She kicks the old woman's jaw.. It SNAPS shut, trapping t envelope between her broken teeth. Muddy water cascades down into the grave, flowing over Mr Ganush's face. It covers everything, except the jutting envelope and a single, staring white eye. Stephanie tries to climb out but the walls are too slick. She grabs at a clump of sod at the top of the hole but it tears away, unleashing an avalanche of mud that buries he to her armpits.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEAD OF MRS. GANUSH
dialogues.text: Bobs up, through the mud. The Old Woman is grinning, with envelope still jammed between her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRAVE
dialogues.text: Rivers of muddy water now pour in from every direction. I has become the drain hole of the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: THE INFLUX OF MUD
dialogues.text: pushes the old woman corpse against Stephanie. Her grinni face led mashed against Stephanie's cheek. Stephanie's SC is cut short as she and Mrs. Ganush disappear beneath the mud. The only sound is the PITTER-PATTER of rain. CAMERA START PULL AWAY when...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: rips up through the mud, grasping the tree root.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Breaks the surface of the mud, sucking in air. She claws way out, then staggers away, through the pouring rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHANIE steps from the shower, quickly towels her hair. stops for a moment and studies herself in the mirror. She has survived. The phone RINGS in the bedroom; the machine picks up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JACKS' VOICE
dialogues.text: Stephanie. It's Jim. Jim Jacks. Sorry I'm calling so early-- but Last night I found some troubling information about our friend Stu Rubin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cleaned up Stephanie, her hair still wet from the showe drives the empty morning streets. A smile slowly comes to face as we hear the rest of Mr. Jack's message:

dialogues.speaker: MR. JACKS' VOICE
dialogues.text: Apparently he stole your file on 4 the Mcpherson loan and then tried to broker his own deal at First Federal. I guess he thought we wouldn't find out. When I confronted him he broke down crying and well, we won't be seeing him around anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eastern sky is growing brighter. Stephanie's car pull into the lot. She removes a week end bag from her trunk a walks briskly toward the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like the loan's coming back to us. And I just wanted you to know that come Monday morning, that assistant manager's position will be waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie is smiling as she enters the station.

dialogues.speaker: A MRS. FIELDS REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: holds a platter of freshly baked cookies and offers free samples to passersby. One is offered to Stephanie. She politely declines as she walks past with a bounce in step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops at the window, admiring a coat on display. She glances down at her own coat. Notes the missing butto with distaste. Inside, a SALESWOMAN is preparing to open the shop. Stephanie taps on the window, shouts through the glass:

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Hey! Good morning.
The Saleswoman opens the door a crack. t

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, we're not open yet.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Please. I know what I want. That coat in the window. The Saleswoman considers.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: My boyfriend and I are taking a very special trip this morning. Stephanie's smile is bright. Her joy is contagious. The Saleswoman relents and lets Stephanie in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments before sunrise, the sky is streaked red. Ray waits on the train platform, clutching two tickets an small garment bag. Behind him, other Passengers arrive. F his pocket, he removes a velvet case. He opens it and pee t inside A diamond ring. He stows it back in his pocket. He looks for Stephanie. Then, his face brightens as Stephanie emerges from the cr radiant in her, new coat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Ray! Ray embraces her and grabs her luggage. A TRAIN WHISTLE sounds as the train approaches.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're here. There's so much I've been meaning to tell you. 0 She takes his hand. 0

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: But let me say this first while I have it straight in my head. You never stopped believing in me. I'll try and live up to that. They share an intimate moment. A romantic kiss. He breaks and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Did I tell you, you look great?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. Stephanie models her new coat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You like it? It's brand new.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What'd you do with your old coat? Just the mention of it, makes her face darken.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I got rid of it. I never want to see it again.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Too bad,'cause I just found this. Ray produces the envelope. And from it, withdraws... THE

dialogues.speaker: CURSED BUTTON
dialogues.text: CAMERA RACES INTO A HUGE CLOSE UP OF THE BUTTON with a terrible CLASHING of symbols!. Stephanie can't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was in my car. Hey, have you seen my Indian Head nickel? I put it in an envelope just like this one. Stephanie stares at the button, shaking her head in disbelief. The RUMBLING of the approaching train builds o the sound track. 4

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What? What is it? She backs away in horror, but Ray follows her with the bu still in his hand. The RUMBLING grows louder. She's backing up toward the ed of the platform.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Stephanie. Stop! Ray steps forward, still holding out the button. Stephani SHRIEKS as she falls backwards, off the platform and onto tracks. In her last moment of life, she turns her head to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE ONCOMING TRAIN
dialogues.text: Racing at her! Through the swirling smoke, the engine's mechanical face, resembles the goat like face of the demon Lamia. It VOMITS STEAM as it angrily bares down upon her.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN WHISTLE SHRIEKS
dialogues.text: Stephanie recognizes the sound. It's a cry she's heard before. In every door creak... in every cold night wind.. haunting, soulless sound... the cry of Lamia. Ray races to the edge of the platform. The two lover's ey find each other one last time. Stephanie SCREAMS as the Lamia swallows her and pulls her down into hell.

dialogues.speaker: THE PEOPLE ON THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Believe they have witnessed a train accident but Ray know the truth. He looks to...

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTTON
dialogues.text: still in his hand.
A look of dread. Finally, he believes.
